question:
Consider the following statements about “Sukanya Samriddhi Yojna”:
  1. It is a small saving scheme governed by Post Office Savings Account Rules, 1981.
  2. A girl child is eligible for Sukanya Samriddhi Account (SSA) only if she is a resident Indian citizen at the time of opening of account
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation:
Salient Features of the scheme are:
  • A Sukanya Samriddhi Account can be opened any time after the birth of a girl till she turns 10, with a minimum deposit of Rs 1,000 and maximum of 1.5 lakh per annum.
  • It is a small saving scheme governed by Post Office Savings Account Rules, 1981.
  • A girl child is eligible for Sukanya Samriddhi Account (SSA) only if she is a resident Indian citizen at the time of opening of account
  • Partial withdrawal facility can be availed in SSY only when the account holder (i.e. the girl child) attains the age of 18 years
